question: A curved line on the surface of the earth that cuts all meridians at the same angle is called a
Magnetic variation is defined as
answers: errors in the compass caused by the magnetic field associated with the metal in the airplane frame and engine.
the difference between the magnetic track and the magnetic heading of the airplane.
the angle between true north and magnetic north at any given point on earth.
the difference between true track and magnetic track.

question: In the northern hemisphere if your airplane is on a northerly heading and if a turn is made towards the east or the west, the compass reading
answers: will lag or indicate a turn in the opposite direction.
will lead or indicate a turn in the opposite direction.
is inversly proportional to the magnetic variation for the particular area.
will be correct, providing the turn has been perfectly coordinated.

question: In an airplane in straight and level flight, the magnetic compass will indicate a turn to the left when
In the vicinity of the magnetic poles there is an area
answers: in which all airplanes must be under positive control.
in which the compass is unreliable.
in which you must reset the heading indicator every 3 minutes.
in which the northerly turning error of the compass is more pronounced than usual.

question: What does a map scale expressed as 1:1,000,000 mean?
answers: 1 inch on the map = one millionth of a mile.
1 inch on the map = 1,000,000 inches on the ground.

question: Complete familiarity with the compass rose is essential to naviation.  Which of these statements is true?
answers: To turn right 90˚ from a heading of 145˚ would be a turn to 235˚.
